ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry reveals bilateral symmetrical mild to moderately severe hearing loss with no air-bone gaps; tympanometry is normal.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To measure individual ear canal acoustics (Real-Ear to Coupler Difference) for accurate hearing aid fitting.
To quantify the proportion of speech cues audible to the patient.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Diagnostic testing revealed a bilateral, symmetrical, mild to moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss. While speech recognition thresholds aligned with pure-tone averages, word recognition scores were disproportionately poor (44-48%) bilaterally. Tympanometry was within normal limits.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical mild to moderately severe hearing loss (PTA ~35 dB).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs 35 dB AU; WRS very poor (48% RT, 44% LT at 75 dB HL).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient returned for hearing aid fitting. Initial programming based on predicted RECDs resulted in patient disappointment. Verification measures showed the patient's ear canals were smaller than average (measured RECD > predicted), leading to under-amplification. Recalculation with measured RECDs demonstrated significantly improved audibility.

tests.name: Real-Ear Measures (RECD Analysis)
tests.result_summary: Measured RECD values were significantly higher than predicted (e.g., 17 dB vs 13 dB at 4000 Hz), indicating smaller ear canal volume.

tests.name: Audibility Calculation (AI)
tests.result_summary: Unaided AI 0.42; Aided AI with predicted RECD 0.74; Aided AI with measured RECD 0.89.

proposed_items: Obtain individual Real-Ear to Coupler Difference (RECD) measures
Program hearing aids to NAL-NL1 targets using measured RECD values
Verify fitting using probe-microphone measures (Real-Ear Aided Response)
counseling_actions: Explain that the patient's ear canals are smaller than average, affecting sound pressure levels
Discuss the difference in audibility between predicted and measured RECD settings
Counsel on the expected improvement in speech clarity (AI 0.89) with the adjusted settings
Discuss the importance of perceived value and satisfaction in hearing aid adoption

escalation.rationale_short: To monitor hearing aid benefit and acclimatization.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing aid benefit, audibility, and patient satisfaction.

expected_outcome: Measured RECD values were markedly greater than predicted values (e.g., 17 dB vs 13 dB at 4000 Hz), confirming smaller ear canal volume.
Aided audibility index (AI) improved from 0.74 using predicted RECDs to 0.89 using measured RECDs.
The use of individual RECD measures is expected to increase perceived value, patient satisfaction, and the likelihood of hearing aid adoption.
